metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8124 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Session fixation vulnerability in the "Remember Me" login feature in Symfony 2.3.x before 2.3.35, 2.6.x before 2.6.12, and 2.7.x before 2.7.7 allows remote attackers to hijack web sessions via a session id.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8124` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-symfony-asset - 2.7.10-0ubuntu2
php-symfony-browser-kit - 2.7.10-0ubuntu2
php-symfony-class-loader - 2.7.10-0ubuntu2
php-symfony-config - 2.7.10-0ubuntu2
php-symfony-console - 2.7.10-0ubuntu2
php-symfony-css-selector - 2.7.10-0ubuntu2
php-symfony-debug - 2.7.10-0ubuntu2
php-symfony-debug-bundle - 2.7.10-0ubuntu2
php-symfony-dependency-injection - 2.7.10-0ubuntu2
php-symfony-dom-crawler - 2.7.10-0ubuntu2
php-symfony-event-dispatcher - 2.7.10-0ubuntu2
php-symfony-expression-language - 2.7.10-0ubuntu2
php-symfony-filesystem - 2.7.10-0ubuntu2

php-symfony-monolog-bridge - 2.7.10-0ubuntu2

No subscription required

criterions.comment: symfony package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.7.10-0ubuntu2').
